metadata.purpose: Systematic, evidence-based running reintroduction for ankle injury recovery leading to combat sports and soccer readiness
research_basis: Mass General Brigham Lateral Ankle Sprain Protocol (2024)
University of Delaware Return to Running Program
International Journal of Sports Physical Therapy - Soccer Return to Sprint
Wilson et al. 2012 - Interference Effect Meta-Analysis
metadata.critical_principle: Running is ESSENTIAL for combat readiness and soccer - but TIMING and READINESS determine success. Premature return = 4x re-injury risk.

combat_sports_requirement.deceleration: Braking forces 2-3x body weight - ankle must handle this
combat_sports_requirement.psychological: Confidence in ankle is as important as physical capacity

soccer_specific_demands.max_velocity_achievement: Soccer players reach 96% max velocity by 21m
soccer_specific_demands.deceleration_frequency: More frequent than accelerations in match play
soccer_specific_demands.cutting_pivoting: Lateral forces demand full ankle stability

why_we_defer_not_skip.tissue_healing_timeline: Ligaments need 12-16 weeks for full remodeling
why_we_defer_not_skip.neural_recovery: Proprioception deficits persist 12+ months without rehab
why_we_defer_not_skip.reinjury_statistics: Ankle sprain has highest re-injury rate of all lower limb injuries
why_we_defer_not_skip.building_foundation: Cycling builds cardio base without compromising ankle healing

phase_1_rehab.focus: Ankle rehab, strength foundation, Zone 2 base

phase_2b_tempo_running.goal: Build running volume, prepare for sprints, pass GATE 3

phase_3_full_sport.goal: Return to soccer, combat sports conditioning

range_of_motion.how_to_test: Foot on tape measure, lunge knee to wall, measure toe-to-wall distance

single_leg_balance.requirement: 60 seconds eyes open, 30 seconds eyes closed, both sides

calf_strength.requirement: 25 repetitions at 2-second tempo without quality loss
calf_strength.rationale: Calf absorbs 6-8x body weight during running

walk_test.requirement: No pain, no limp, no swelling afterwards
walk_test.rationale: Walking is running at low intensity - must be effortless

plyometric_readiness.progression: Two-foot → Single-foot when double is easy

agent_decision.all_pass: Clear to begin Phase 2A walk-jog progression
agent_decision.any_fail: Continue Phase 1 rehab, retest in 1-2 weeks

single_leg_hop_battery.how_to_test: Best of 3 trials each leg, calculate involved/uninvolved × 100
single_leg_hop_battery.rationale: Hop tests assess power, proprioception, and confidence

side_hop_test.test: Lateral hop over 30cm line × 10 reps for time
side_hop_test.rationale: Assesses lateral stability crucial for direction changes

agent_decision.all_pass: Clear to begin Phase 2B tempo running
agent_decision.any_fail: Continue walk-jog progression, address deficits, retest in 1-2 weeks

continuous_running.rationale: Must handle sustained moderate intensity before max efforts

hop_test_progression.test: All four hop tests + Side Hop + Figure-8 Hop
hop_test_progression.rationale: Sprinting loads exceed hopping - need buffer

deceleration_tolerance.rationale: Braking forces are higher than acceleration forces

psychological_readiness.rationale: Fear and apprehension increase injury risk

agent_decision.all_pass: Clear to begin Phase 2C sprint introduction
agent_decision.any_fail: Continue tempo running, address specific deficits, retest in 1-2 weeks

gate_4_full_sport_clearance.name: GATE 4: Ready for Full Sport Return

sport_specific_simulation.rationale: Final integration test before full return

agent_decision.all_pass: CLEARED for full sport participation with ongoing monitoring
agent_decision.any_fail: Continue Phase 2C, address specific issues, retest

walk_jog_progression.name: University of Delaware Return to Running Protocol (Modified)
walk_jog_progression.surface: Treadmill preferred initially (controlled), progress to grass/track
walk_jog_progression.frequency: Every other day minimum, max 4 sessions per week

progression_rules.advance_when: Complete level pain-free with no swelling 24h post
progression_rules.drop_one_level_if: Sore DURING workout, take 1 day off
progression_rules.drop_two_levels_if: Sore during WARMUP, take 2 days off

level_1.protocol: 0.1 mile walk / 0.1 mile jog - repeat 10 times

track_alternative.level_2: Jog straights / Jog 1 curve every other lap - 2 miles
track_alternative.level_3: Jog straights / Jog 1 curve every lap - 2 miles

tempo_running_phase.name: Phase 2B: Building Running Capacity
goals: Build running volume to 30+ continuous minutes

week_17.session_3: Easy jog 20 min with 4 × 20s strides at 70% effort

week_18.session_2: Tempo run: 5 min easy, 10 min at 75% effort, 5 min easy
week_18.session_3: Easy jog 25 min with 5 × 20s strides at 75% effort

week_19.session_2: Tempo run: 5 min easy, 15 min at 75-80% effort, 5 min easy

week_20.session_2: Tempo run: 5 min easy, 20 min at 80% effort, 5 min easy
week_20.session_3: Progression run: Start easy, finish at tempo pace for final 10 min

strides_protocol.form_focus: Tall posture, relaxed shoulders, quick turnover

critical_principles.maximal_intent: Even at 70% effort, INTEND to accelerate maximally
critical_principles.full_recovery: Sprint quality over quantity - 2-3 min between reps
critical_principles.surface: Grass preferred initially (forgiving), progress to firmer surfaces
critical_principles.session_frequency: 2 sprint sessions per week max, 72h between

flying_sprint_protocol.what: Sprint with running start (not from standstill)
flying_sprint_protocol.setup: 10-15m build-up zone, then max effort for 20-30m
flying_sprint_protocol.purpose: Achieves higher velocities with lower acceleration stress

deceleration_training.importance: Deceleration forces exceed acceleration forces - must train

principles.slow_before_fast: Walking COD → Jogging COD → Running COD → Sprint COD

repeated_sprint_ability_development.name: RSA Training Protocol
repeated_sprint_ability_development.why_important: Soccer players perform 1350+ sprints per match, often in clusters
repeated_sprint_ability_development.research_basis: Repeated Sprint Training improves VO2max, anaerobic capacity, and speed

advanced_rsa.metric: Track fatigue decrement (final sprint time vs first)

integration_with_cod.name: RSA with Direction Changes
integration_with_cod.research: COD during RSA provides greater stimulus than straight sprints

if_running_scheduled: Check WBLT both ankles (must be within 2cm)
Confirm no swelling from previous session
Verify 48h since last running session (Phase 2A) or 72h (sprint sessions)

gate_test_scheduling.agent_reminder: Schedule gate test when approaching week milestone

stop_immediately_if: Sharp pain in ankle during running
Pain that increases as you continue

psychological_readiness.importance: Athletes with fear/anxiety at RTS have higher reinjury rates

interventions_for_low_confidence.gradual_exposure: More repetitions at current level before advancing
interventions_for_low_confidence.positive_self_talk: Replace 'my ankle is weak' with 'my ankle is getting stronger'
interventions_for_low_confidence.controlled_challenges: Succeed at slightly harder task to build confidence

weeks_17_20_modifications.running_sessions: Replace some cycling with tempo running
weeks_17_20_modifications.maintain_cycling_for_zone_2: Running is higher intensity, need cycling for true Zone 2

weeks_21_24_modifications.sprint_sessions: Tuesday AND Saturday dedicated to sprint development
weeks_21_24_modifications.strength_maintained: Critical for sprint power - do not reduce

week_17_20.running: Tempo runs, strides, building to 30min continuous

week_20.tests: Advanced hop tests, T-test baseline, deceleration

week_24.tests: Max sprints, RSA, reactive agility, sport simulation

week_25_plus.status: Ongoing monitoring, gradual return to match intensity
